title: Coca-Cola Earnings inline, Revenue beats In Q3
text:
© Reuters. Coca-Cola Earnings inline, Revenue beats In Q3

Investing.com - Coca-Cola (NYSE: ) reported third quarter that matched analysts' expectations on Friday and revenue that topped forecasts.

The firm reported earnings per share of $0.56 on revenue of $9.51B. Analysts polled by Investing.com anticipated EPS of $0.56 on revenue of $9.45B. That compared to EPS of $0.58 on revenue of $8.26B in the same period a year earlier. The company had reported EPS of $0.63 on revenue of $10B in the previous quarter.

For the year, Coca-Cola shares are up 13.66%, under-performing the which is up 21.03% year to date.

Coca-Cola follows other major Consumer/Non-Cyclical sector earnings this month

On Thursday, October 3, 2019, PepsiCo reported third quarter EPS of $1.56 on revenue of $17.19B, compared to forecasts of EPS of $1.5 on revenue of $16.93B.

Philip Morris earnings beat analyst's expectations on Thursday, with third quarter EPS of $1.43 on revenue of $7.64B. Investing.com analysts expected EPS of $1.36 on revenue of $7.65B

Stay up-to-date on all of the upcoming earnings reports by visiting Investing.com's earnings calendar
description: Coca-Cola Earnings inline, Revenue beats In Q3
